15511.content:
You wake up to find yourself on the floor in a very cold place. Looking up, you see a giant girl who looks like she's from the water tribe. She's looking down at you with a smile on her face.


"Hi there. So you've woken up i see." The girl says.


"Huh? What happened? How did i get here? And why are you so big?" You say, hearing her giggle after you say that.


"To answer your questions in order, i don't know, i brought you here, and I'm not big, you're just small." You slowly stand up and look around, realizing she's telling the truth upon seeing all the giant sized things in what you could only guess was her room.


"As for the reason you're small in the first place, that was my doing." You quickly turned around to look back at her when she said that.


"What? You did this to me? Why?"


"Well when i found you, you sort of fell out of the sky and into the ocean. It's really cold this time of year, and by the time i fished you out, i thought for sure you were going to die. But i managed to bring you back to my place and keep your body warm before that could happen."


"Really? You did all that for a stranger like me?"


"Of course."


"But that doesn't explain why I'm so small."


"Simple. I found a scroll in your arms when i pulled you up. You had a firm grip on it, even unconscious. But after i pried from your iron grip, i saw the technique written on it for something called size bending.


"Size bending? You mean you used that on me to shrink me down? But why?"


"Well, i figured you owed me for saving your life, and there's something I've really wanted to do for a long time, but could never do. Until now that is."


"And what is that?"


"Simple. I'm going to shrink you down to around a centimeter in height, and then I'm going to toss you in my mouth and swallow you." At that moment, your whole body was paralyzed by fear. Was this girl really going to eat you like some kind of snack?


"Oh don't worry, the technique also showed me something for granting immunity to digestive acids, so you won't be killed by that anyway. And it's not like you can say no." At that moment, she started doing hand signs, and before you could react, you had shrunken down to one centimeter tall.


Now looking up at the even bigger girl, you could see her lowering her hand down to pick you up. You tried to run away, but failed as she grasped you by your clothes and lifted you up to her face and opened her mouth up. You started screaming as she flicked you onto her tongue and closed her mouth, sealing you in darkness.

155332222222111.title: Twilight Sparkle.

1553322222221111.content:
(Note From the author: This little idea has now been turned into a full story on fimfiction. Here's the link if you're interested: http://www.fimfiction.net/story/262103/a... )

Alex jumped awake. He hadn’t even realized he’d fallen asleep. It was a strange scene that met him. He was lying in purple grass and the sky over head was completely white. As he tried to make sense of this, a sound caught his attention. It sounded like someone gasping and it seemed come from behind him. He sat up and turned to see the source…And his jaw dropped.

Just behind him was a pair of gigantic purple eyes staring right at him. He slowly looked down. The ‘grass’ he was sitting on was fur. The fur on the giant creature’s muzzle. Above him was the creature’s forehead on which was a giant purple unicorn horn. Just above that was the creature’s mane, dark purple with a pink highlight running down the bangs.

Alex realized two things. He was sitting on the muzzle of a giant pony. And that pony was Twilight Sparkle and she was looking right at him…




Neither Twilight nor Alex could believe the strange new reality that was before them. They just stared at each other for several seconds as their brains tried to catch up with what their eyes were seeing. A tiny human and a giant pony, each was impossible to the other, and yet here they were.

Alex’s eyes wandered from Twilight’s to the area around him. From his position on Twilight’s nose, Alex was able to see they were in a hallway of some kind. White marble covered the walls and floor while golden buttresses hung from the ceiling. The walls had various things from oil paintings of regal ponies to tapestries and banners of a golden sun. Alex recognized it at once as one of the hallways of Canterlot Castle, the home of Princess Celestia.

So, they weren’t inside Twilight’s castle. Alex looked back at Twilight and tried to take in as much of her as he could. Instantly he noticed the lack of big purple wings on her sides. She wasn’t a princess yet. This meant he was somewhere in MLP’s past. But when? And more importantly, how? How was he sitting on the nose of a fictional character? What did it mean?

“Um, excuse me?” He was pulled from his surge of questions by Twilight’s soft voice. “Are you…a human?”

Alex nodded, their eyes locked on each other once again. He watched as a mad gleam of excitement grew in Twilight’s eyes, her nose quivering a little as she broke out in a smile. Alex was suddenly lifted into the air a sparkling purple aura surrounded him, pulling him a little farther away from Twilight so she could get a better look. He began turning in different directions as Twilight examined him.

“Let’s see. A small patch of hair on the head, bipedal, no hooves but hands and fingers. Full body clothes and an overall appearance similar to apes. Oh you are a wonderful find.”

“Thank you?” Alex said a little unsure of what was going on. “Um, where am I?”

However, Twilight seemed to ignore him. “Oh my gosh. I have to take you to the Princess. She’ll definitely want to see you. Let’s go!”

Without another word, Twilight began running off in what Alex figured was the throne room…

They were dated to have another big summer storm in two weeks, and the manager was set to make sure everything was ready. So, most of the workers had been to given double shifts to prepare. Luckily, tomorrow was the start of Rainbow Dash's two days off, so things were looking up again.

As Dash flew along, her joy at being free again slowly built. The urge to do a few celebratory laps around Ponyville grew as well and Dash was not one to pass on the chance of some flying. The rainbow maned mare smiled smuggly as she began to increase speed, climbing into the air as she went. Nopony would mind her doing a few tricks as well, right?...



As dusk began to set over Ponyville a small fly named Frank made his way home, a crack in Fluttershy's cottage floor. It had been one hell of a week for him. Normally, as a fly, his life was pretty crappy. Ponies usually took shots at him when they saw him or, for the more angry ones, they used the spray. These were annoying but easy to avoid. No, the newest threat was a recuring nightmare caused by one pony.

"AAAAAHHHHH YYYEEEAAAHHH!!!!!" A sonic boom shook the area as a rainbow colored shockwave passed over head.

"Oh no." Frank groaned.

He turned just in time to see a giant blue pony with rainbow mane heading straight for him.

"Rainbow Dash..."

(Alright, you know where this is going. How does he end up inside her?)

Sam opened his eyes as a strange feeling came over him. Looking down he realized what the feeling was. It was his equilibrium giving out from the fact that he was currently several feet in the air and free falling as gravity took over.

"Crap!" He cried as he fell. Panic set in as the ground rose up to meet him.

Pulling the wrist computer to his face, Sam began typing away in a blur of fingers. "Come on, come on." He growled.

The computer just buzzed and showed an error message across its screen. Sam grit his teeth and began slamming his fist on the screen. He glanced down, the ground only feet away now. He was going to die.

"COME ON!" With one final roar of desperation, Sam struck the computer again. This time it worked.

A loud humming sound came from the computer and Sam felt himself stop in mid air, his face just inches from the ground. The anti-grav system had thankfully turned on just in time. He breathed a sigh of relief. Quickly righting himself, Sam placed his feet on the ground just as the computer gave one last buzzing sound before shutting down completely.

"Damn." He thought annoyed. "I knew inter dimensional would be difficult. But I didn't think it would fry the computer that fast. Hopefully I landed in the right place so I can get Twilight's help."

Sam looked around at his surroundings. He was in the middle of a dirt road with fields of flowers on each side. The road itself lead to a rather dark looking forest at one end and turning, he saw his destination at the other. Ponyville.

"Good," he thought." Now at least something went right."

Though glancing at the flowers nearby, Sam realized his problems weren't over yet. The flowers were massive, nearly as big as skyscrapers in his own world. Everything else matched the size of the flowers too. he had been shrunken on his way through the portal and with the computer damaged, he had no way to restore his size or fly over to Ponyville. Walking would most certainly take several days at his size, and that was time he really didn't have.

Luck was on his side though. AS he was thinking about what to do, the sounds of hooves clapping on the gravel road drew his attention. It was coming from the forest. Sam turned and saw...

*A few seconds before...*

Apple Jack was doing what she did best, Apple Bucking on the farm. The sun was shinning, there was a pleasant breeze and the weather promised a cool afternoon. All was well with the world, until...

AJ was leaning over to pick up a bucket when suddenly she felt something strike her anus and squeeze in before getting jammed half way inside her. She jumped at the strange feeling, wheeling around to see if somepony had snuck up on her. With no one seemingly around she tried to remove the strange object only to find it was too small for her to reach.

She was about to head up to the farm house to ask for help, when Rarity trotted up to her with a worried expression...


*Sam's POV*

Sam groaned in the humid darkness he now found himself in. He had been launched into the anus of another pony after Rarity accidently sneezed him off her nose. And of course, just as added misery, Sam found himself only half way inside the ring of muscles, stuck up to his waist with arms pinned to his sides and his legs hanging in the outside world.

"You know what?" Sam grumbled to himself. "All I wanted to do was explore another world. Travel around, see the sights, maybe exchange scientific knowledge with the locals. But no. My computer breaks down, I'm shrunk, and now I am struck in the ass of SOME RANDOM PONY! AND WHY DOES IT SMELL LIKE APPLES?!"

His angry yell echoed off the organic walls in his dark prison. Sam let out his pent up rage and tried to relax. He'd need to a plan to get out of this bizarre situation, and that would require a level head.

However, just as he was starting to form the blue prints of a plan, Sam felt something gently grab his legs. It began trying to pull him out of the pony butt, though it held firm. He did feel himself slide out a bit as the unknown force pulled. It greed his arms just enough to allow him to start pushing himself out along with the force.

After a few seconds and one final great pull, Sam popped out of the pony behind and enjoyed the sweet smell of fresh air...For a few seconds.


*Rarity's POV, a few seconds ago*

Rarity opened her eyes after her sneeze, only to find Sam had been launched off. Panic set in as she charged ahead, hoping she could follow his trajectory. Her eyes quickly caught sight of Sam flying through the air. She moved faster to catch him, only to stop dead as he landed...In the butt of her friend, Apple Jack.

Apple Jack whipped around at the feeling and Rarity moved fast to help. AJ looked up to see Rarity coming towards her with panic in her eyes. The Earth Pony seemed to try and hide her plot related issues from her friend.

"Hey, Rarity." She said nervously as the unicorn stopped in front of her. "How ya all doing?"

"Not now, Apple Jack." Rarity grabbed her friend and spun her around to face AJ's backside. "I need to removed Sam from you."

"What?" AJ shouted. "You know what flew up my rump?"

"Not a what, a who. Sam, a little human in a rather unfortunate predicament. I'll explain later, for now just hold still."

"Alright." AJ lowered her head to the ground and held up her behind to Rarity.

Rarity examined AJ's plot and found Sam's legs wiggling in a vain attempt to free himself. In her panicked mine, Rarity forgot to use magic and simply grabbed hold of the human's legs with her mouth. Trying very hard not to think about the fact she had her lips near another pony's rear, Rarity began pulling as gently as possible. She made slow progress until with one final pull, Sam was freed and Rarity fell backwards, losing her grip on the tiny human...

(Well, this IS an endo story. Ready to get the 'endo' part started?)

1553322222221222112.content:
Sam decided to travel deeper into Rarity's ear. His main mission in coming here in the first place was to research these odd magical pony creatures. So, might as well start with some pony anatomy. He walked farther in, switching on the flash light built into his wrist computer.

After about ten minutes of walking through the ear canal, Sam becoming slightly sick of seeing nothing but pink fleshy walls and small yellow patches of ear wax. At first he thought maybe Rarity wasn't as clean as she pretended to be, but he soon realized that these patches were ether too small or too deep for rarity to ever reach on her own. He quickly decided that he didn't care ether way, and just wanted to see something else besides earwax.

Finally, Sam found lights flashing from around the corner ahead. He moved right through it and was met with the most amazing sight of his life. He had come into a huge chamber, clearly the hollow center of the white unicorn's skull. Starting from the floor and rising high to the top of the chamber was a giant grey fleshy organ, the brain. All around the brain arches of multicolored electricity danced up and down the organ, sometimes even crossing in brilliant flashes in light.

Sam's mouth hung open. It was a strangely beautiful sight. For a time he simply stood there and admired the natural activity of this miracle of the natural world. An organic computer, perfect in design and powerful beyond measure. He vaguely wondered if his own brain acted like tis or if this sight was the result of rarity's magical origins.

After he recovered his breath a bit, Sam looked around at the area. Belong the brain, countless 'wires' grew out of the organ and moved down through a hole at the bottom, the entrance to spinal cord. He activated his wrist computer again. It was set to scan the brain and try to figure out how it worked. As it went about its job, Sam continued to watch the brain. Then, the damaged computer acted up again.

Sam felt his wrist heat up. "What the hell?"

The computer started sparking and glowing as the AI spoke. "Error. Unknown energy detected. System is compromised."

"What do you mean?" Sam shouted.

"System over load imminent. Prepare for electrical discharge."

Sam's eyes widened in horror. "No! Abort discharge. We are inside an organic being. A discharge could be harmful. Abort discharge."

But it was too late. The screen burst into a blue light as lightning shot out from the wrist computer and hit the brain dead center. Sam was thrown back and slammed against the inner wall of Rarity's head and knocked out...

155332222222122221221.content:
(Black Jack and the idea for this story comes from darklordzx5. You'll see him soon)

Black Jack hung limply as he struggled to fly in his injured state. Things had not gone well for him on his first day in Equestria. He was hungry, lost, homeless and without hope, not to mention the many injuries covering his exoskeleton after the harsh battle. You see, Black Jack was a changeling.

Not a member of Queen Chrysalis' hive, Black Jack hailed from a hive hidden in the Griffon Kingdom. He had been exiled from the hive after he refused to a mission. Leaving his home behind, Black Jack traveled to Equestria in the hope that he could find asylum, ether with the ponies or with Queen Chrysalis herself. Both hopes were quickly dashed when he learned of the failed invasion of Canterlot. The hive went deep into hiding and Equestria sentiments for Changelings were at an all time low. He had no other choice but to hide as well, grabbing small its of love from here and there as he went.

Things took a turn for the worst that morning. He had no idea how bad it would get. And he regretted it even now..


*Flash back to about an hour ago.*

Black Jack was enjoying a rare moment of peace. He was out in a forest clearly full of flowers, choosing to forgo his shape shifting disguise in favor of his usual form. He was alone and far removed from the local roadway after all. Who could see him?

He bent down to smell a few flowers when it happened. The air sudden filled with magical energy. He could feel it all swirling around and flowing into a single point right behind him. His instincts took over and Black Jack dived to the left, just in time as a beam spell ripped through the ground he had just been standing on.

He turned and saw a single grey furred unicorn glaring at him. Black Jack groaned. He was in no shape to fight and he didn't have magic to begin with to battle a unicorn on his own. His only hope was to try and talk the unicorn down.

"Hi." He said calmly. "Look. I'm not sure what I've done to anger you, but I'll happily move on if want. I don't wan to fight you."

"Too bad, bug." The Unicorn snapped. "After what your kind did in Canterlot, you really think I'm just going to let you walk away? Not a chance. Get ready to fight or get ready to die!"

The unicorn fired again, Black Jack again dodging the attack. The Changeling went into full survival mode. he took to the sky in an effort to run, only to slam into a magic barrier. The unicorn was much smarter than he thought. With no choice but to fight, Jack dive bombed his opponent, hoping a head on attack would catch the unicorn off guard...It didn't.

Before he hit the unicorn, a rock slammed into his side. Black Jack was sent spinning into the ground. As he looked up he saw three more rocks held in the unicorn's magic zoom straight at him. The first two hit home, striking him in the head and one of his wings. Black Jack staggered out of the way as another volley of rocks rained down on him.

However, in his dazed state, Jack was unable to avoid the third blast of magic. It struck him hard in the chest. He went flying into a tree, smashing right through it before stopping against another one behind it.

By now Black Jack was in really bad shape. Luck was on his side though. During the attack the barrier lowered just enough for him to get threw. Ignoring the searing pain all over his body, the Changeling charged through, trying desperately to escape the unicorn's wrath. Just before he made it, another spell struck him. He only realized what the spell did after he had gotten away.

*End Flash Back*

Black Jack buzzed over to a nearby apple tree, quickly sitting on a branch to rest after the huge strain. The spell shrunk him,. He was somewhere around the size of an ant or smaller. His injuries were almost life threatening. If he didn't get some 'love' to feed on quick he was in big trouble.

Just as he wondered what to do, an orange earth pony with an apple Cutie Mark waked up to his little tree, a smile on her face, and love in her eyes...

Ok, you know where this is going. Have fun.
155332222222122221221.title: A Changeling's Desperation

He shock his head at the bad pun and decide to go more deeper, ignoring and avoiding it but the more deeper he went the more large chunk of earwax were inside, eventually he reached to the vibrating curved wall that was Tympanic Membrane- other wise called the ear drum meant for the transference of sound.

there no way around.

Ugh, I need to use magic to get inside the changeling tough, his horn glowed in red magic then he become transparent, it was a one of the special talents of his hive, The Red Sun, they were a changeling hive allied with the Griffin Kingdom, in exchange for living the their land, most of the red sun hive specialist acts a spy for the gryphons and in return they give a nice supplement of Love Potions

The Griffins mantained the hive in secret, only high ups of the kingdom know about them. unlike Chrysalis' hive that specialist in mind control and deception, The Red Sun are specialist in spionage and invisibility to the point that there are offshots of the same spell (invisibility) like "ghost" spell Black is using.

here we go The ling exiled quickly walked throught the vibrating membrane passing to the other side quickly, Above him were the smallest bones in the body, and the continuation of the sound transference to the brain: the Malleus, Incus, and Stapes, otherwise known as the Hammer, Anvil, and Stirrup.

The changeling almost fell himself more weaker about to fall in exhaustion but he didn't give in, he needed to travel to the pony's brain and feed on her love before is too late.

so far minutes of flying inward in a large but short passage he arrive the central area of the skull, the hollow area that hold the large pony brain.

he didn't have time for admire it, right now he lands and walked toward the frontal lobe just arriving he manage to start the syphoning spell to eat the love.

1553322222221222221.content: So, which story. Mine or yours?
1553322222221222221.title: Fluttershy

15533222222212222211.content:
"Where are we, Captain?"

A tall, middle-aged man with a buzzcut turned around to address his charges. His name was Captain Lance Shoemaker, pilot of one of seven trans-dimensional pods S.S. Oasis that had taken a chunk of the population to this world.

"We appear to be in a garden of some sort.. be sure to watch out for animals, if they can see us. This is the designated meeting point for our new colony. Captain Villareal and the others decided on it." the man said.

It had been two weeks since the S.S Oasis and the other six ships arrived in Equestria. Earth had been torn apart by the worst epidemic in history, and quarantined with the city of Phoenix, Arizona were the last 2,218 humans alive. Two technological revolutions for space and dimensional travel had been progressing to find some way to escape the planet and the disease, and it was clear that dimensional travel won out.

Before the disease wiped out the human race, the last 2,000 humans were transported to the only other dimension that they knew existed, the world of Equestria, with all the supplies they could think about for mustering up a new life. They had been able to view it through their monitors, the peaceful (even magical!) world inhabited by strange, pony-esque creatures.

"Um... Captain..." a young man in his late teens or early twenties said, walking up to Shoemaker. His name was Martin, one of the 15 people under Shoemaker's jurisdiction.

"What is it, son?"

"Have we finally found one? A pony?" he asked. None of the group had ever seen a pony before, but it had been planned out that they were going to make the inside of a pony's body their new home.

One of the unexpected side effects of the travel was that Equestria was apparently a lot BIGGER than their world. Humans were barely the size of ants, if that. From the scouting reports, their vessels had touched down outside a peaceful hamlet, though it was so big that it would be impossible to get there in a decent amount of time. They had the supplies, but they couldn't survive out in the world with giant bugs, giant animals, and other dangers.

They were going to build a new civilization within the body of the first pony they saw. It had taken two weeks for Group 6D, Martin's group, to get to the designated point. They were ballooned the farthest away when they had arrived.

"Is that a... cottage?" a woman in the group asked.

Martin strained his neck to see up and in the distance. A tall mound that he could just barely see the top of loomed above them. It was like a round house with grass growing on top of it.

"Yes, the occupant of that house is a pony named "Fluttershy". Based on our intel, she is the perfect host for us. There should be other people there at the docking bay, ready to brief us.

The trek into Fluttershy's cottage lasted nearly another day, but the group of fifteen was definitely relieved by the time they slipped underneath the crack to her door, which was like a giant overhead mountain above them.

pound... pound... pound...

Just as the group entered the fold, a massive yellow pillar entered Martin's view, followed by another one. He craned his head as a wave of fear overcame him, in the heavens was a cladestine pink mane miles above them.

"Let's move, people!" Shoemaker said. "We need to get to the bed by nightfall!"

"T-That's a pony?" Martin asked. He could see the vaguely equine shape, but the goddess-like face gave off a remarkably human-like expression. This one in particular seemed gentle despite her size.

By nightfall, the group had reached the bed, panting for breath.

"Captain Shoemaker! Captain Shoemaker!" a small, Latino man greeted them, flying down from a moving, metallic platform. The man had apparently been up on the bed.

"Captain Villareal! It's good to see you!"

"Glad you all could make it! We have found our future home! Your group was the last one we were searching for, and now we'll all together to begin our new life!"

"I see you have already installed much of our technology..."

"Haha! Yeah! Lemme tell you, it was hard as hell to be one of the first groups here! We had to set up lifts and platforms to help the later groups. Most everyone is already inside the body, it's just me and a few others on the welcoming committee! Let's get you all up though!"

Villareal pulled a remote from his vest, pressing a button as a metal lift extending from up on the bed. Martin, Shoemaker, and the others were lifted from the wooden floor up onto the plush magenta sheets.

"Whoa!" Martin said to himself, reeling at the unlevel ground. That was caused by the titanic weight of the massive Fluttershy, who was laying on her back, sleeping soundly with a soft smile on her face.

They had been deposited right on the middle of the bed, where Villareal stepped off the lift.

"Now, we've already set up several towns with Fluttershy. It's been a filing nightmare, lemme tell you, but we've got the basic necessities, and we're trying to figure out some bureaucratic processes. There are eight towns, each within its own Sector. As Group 6D, you will be assigned to one of them as your living space and given a duty while we get this place up and running. These are all a work in progress! I'll run you through each one!"

"Sector 1: The Brain. A quarter of our population lives here, in our "capital" and central control. We run day-to-day affairs and used electrical impulses to communicate with the body. Right now, we're on top of the grey matter, but we're exploring underneath to see what we can use to our advantage."

"Sector 2: The Lungs: Controls our oxygen supply, with one half of the town in each lung."

"Sector 3: The Heart: Main base is in the heart itself, but this sector is our postal system, using the bloodstream to send mail throughout Fluttershy."

"Sector 4: The Stomach: Part of our explored frontier. We're still figuring out this one, though we believe we can get our food supply here."

"Sector 5: The Nose: Related to Sector 2, and in control of oxygen."

"Sector 6: The Mouth: Underneath Fluttershy's tongue, we have a small village going."

"Sector 7: The Ear: The Communications district. We have one colony set up within the right ear, which is used to relay sound waves and information about the outside world to central control."

"Sector 8: The Liver: We study poisons that may be dangerous to us here"

"That's all of them. It's turning out to be an interesting place, and now that you're here, we'll be complete. Now, let me just get your file here!" Villareal said.

Martin looked at him in amazement. They had already come so far in a couple short weeks, to turn a living body into a society.

Villareal looked them over, while opening a pamphlet.

"Let's see... according to your files, Sector 6D has been assigned to....
15533222222212222211.title: New Colony

155332222222122222111.content:
"Sector 7! Fluttershy's ear!" Villareal told Shoemaker. Shoemaker and Martin both looked at each other, and then at the rest of the crowd to gauge their reaction.

There were a few slight murmurs to one another, but overall they seemed to think it was an okay destination. All that was left was to get into the sleeping titaness in front of them.

"Alright, let's get you in there!" Villareal said.

After taking another platform, the fifteen people were at the edge of the pillow. Fluttershy was asleep on her back with her head on the pillow, but only the back of her ears were touching the pillow. The entrance to the ear canal would require climbing, something that fifteen people shouldn't do all at once.

"If these were human ears, we could probably get you in on foot, but..." Villareal said. He pulled out a whistle from the seemingly endless vest he had, and blew into it sharply.

Fluttershy's right ear twitched only slightly, but that wasn't the intended result. Three men in hazmat suits heard the whistle and emerged from the thicket of Fluttershy's nearly endless pink mane. They shimmied their way up the back, each one stopping at various points. When the last one reached the very tip of Fluttershy's ear, they all pulled out three mechanical claws and sunk them into the flesh.

They grabbed onto the handle and pulled with all their might, pulling the yellow flap of Fluttershy's ear back and stretching the cartilage. Martin took a step forward as the entrance to the canal became visible.

"Gonna need this!" Villareal said, depositing a mining helmet on Martin's head. "Care to do the honors, kid?"

Martin gulped and stepped up, even before Shoemaker himself. He pulled himself over the ridge that was the tragus, feeling the fuzzy, yellow ground for the first time.

He turned on the light, peering into the vast abyss of the ear. It was like a cave. With a deep breath, he took a step forward, watching the dim light around him go out as fleshy ceiling hung far far above him.

Outside, the others lined up in a single file line at the entrance to the oblivious pony's ear. Martin looked back and noted it with amusement. It was a comical scene.

The floor was fuzzy, but not nearly as much as outside. He heard voices from behind; the others were entering as well. They ought to be careful with their voices.

The ground dipped before him as it became a bowl shape. He must've left the entrance and entered the canal proper. He had to trudge through the forest of hairs, his comrades right behind him.

The village was near the back of the canal, right before the eardrum, but they couldn't see it yet.
155332222222122222111.title: Entering Sector 7

choices: Take a tour of the eardrum.
1553322222221222221111.content:
Martin and his group continued to walk through Fluttershy's ear canal, marveling at the amount of space there truly was. The "trees" around them were taller than they were, and were covered in a chunky yellow wax.

"Yaaghh!" a cry from a man alarmed Martin. The young ear spelunker turned around to see another in their group covered in the same wax from head to toe. He was screaming as he struggled in a pile of the substance, and the more he struggled, the more he stuck to the walls.

He had apparently wandered off to the side, feeling a little too adventurous.

"Duh. Ear wax... That's what this stuff is..."

Surprisingly, he wasn't really disgusted all that much by it. There were far worse places in the body where they could've been living; the ear of this pony was probably a safe place.

Captain Shoemaker sighed.

"Alright, alright. Just hold on..."

After pulling the man out of the wax, Martin and the rest continued through the forest of hairs. Fluttershy seemed a remarkably gentle and feminine individual, but there was a surprising amount of ear wax in here.

"Look!" Shoemaker shouted. Off in the distance, a couple miles (by their standards) away, the forest ended as the ground sloped forward once more into a hill. There was a large pinkish disc that marked the end of the canal, and a much smaller, very visible settlement just before the disc.

"That must be the eardrum... and look! There are about a couple dozen houses and buildings just before it! That must be our new home!" Shoemaker said.

"Wow! They really got things up and running fast! They already have houses built!" Martin replied. About forty minutes of walking later, and he was working his way up the slope.

"We're here!" he said in relief. The other humans had built the village upon a caldera of flesh just before the eardrum. The first building he came across was made of metal, and he was a hand across it. They had even used the earwax for stability in the foundation!

A soft pounding resided in his head. The place needed some form of architectural stability, as every little sound would vibrate the apparent eardrum flanking the village.

The largest building in the village was in the back, and it was kind of tower. Martin noticed it's clear purpose was to be an elevator, because on the very top floor was a metal catwalk connecting the tower to the center of the eardrum.

That catwalk branched off perpendicularly to another identical catwalk, which was built into the drum itself and served as a hallway to either side, where there were two buildings built into each side of the drum. Martin didn't know what purpose they served yet, but he could see a few people scurrying about up there, the lights in the building giving them away.

The most striking thing was at the top center of the eardrum, where a large metal dish and antenna stuck out of the eardrum.

"Ah, I see you've seen our pride and joy!" a middle aged man with a vest said, greeting Martin and his group as they took in the village. What do they do next?
1553322222221222221111.title: Town in the Ear.

15533222222212222211111.content:
"This is amazing!" Martin yelped, seeing the two buildings and dish built into the hard material of the pony's tympanic membrane. "How did you guys possibly build this in just two weeks?"

"We have our ways..." the middle-aged man said, wiggling his eyebrows. "Please, allow me to introduce myself. My name is Dr. Henry Levi, the director of eardrum central control and mayor of our little town. I trust you lot are the new refugees."

Shoemaker nodded.

"That we are. We were hoping to get a tour of our new home, especially since we'll be staying here a while..."

"Of course, sir." Levi said. "I trust most of you will want to get all your housing arrangements. The trek through the ear canal can be quite a long journey, not to mention a dangerous. Though, if any of you are interested, I could give you a tour of the facility..." he said, gesturing to the modified eardrum. "I imagine this is where a great number of you will be working..."

Martin was intrigued, the buildings of Central Control were quite a bit more complex than the little townhouses down below. The young man stepped forward, and with great surprise noticed that he was the only one to do so.

"Excellent!" Levi clapped him on the shoulder. "Come along son, I'll show you the ropes..."

While the rest of the group followed another director into one of the townhouses, Martin trudged through the tiny yellow hairs, up a small fleshy ridge until he could actually touch the eardrum.

With great curiousity, he stood alongside Levi, and noticed that the eardrum was constantly vibrating.

He almost yelped when the disk before him opened like a door, just enough to allow them to enter it like it was an elevator.

"Shall we?" Levi smiled.
15533222222212222211111.title: Eardrum Center Control

155332222222122222111112.content:
"Lalalalalalalalala!

"What a beautiful morning!"

The butter yellow pegasus known as Fluttershy wandered around her cottage around the time of mid-morning, sunlight filtering through her windows. It was time to feed her animal friends, so naturally she was very chipper around this time of day.

Of course, she was also unaware that a group of tiny humans were building an advanced civilization within her own body. She did however, know that she had been feeling very weird these days.

Her motor skills seemed increased, her hearing was sharper, and she was had to take in loads more calories at dinner in order to feel satisfied. It had been going on for a few weeks now.

It wasn't just a gradual change either, it had been so sudden that it was almost scary. And while most of the changes seemed positive, there were a few that were kind of scary.

When she was all alone, she heard them. Voices in her hand, hundreds of them all speaking in little more than a teeny, tiny, miniscule whisper. She could only hear them at certain times, and if she strained really hard, but she knew they were there.

There had also been a tingling taking place in her stomach, and sometimes her brain throbbed mildly.

"It's settled then! I will go to the doctor tomorrow!" she said, smiling and humming to herself once more...
155332222222122222111112.title: The Unaware Pegasus

choices: Martin and Levi journey to the brain.
1553322222221222221111121.content:
"It's settled then! I will go to the doctor tomorrow!

Fluttershy's own voice bounced off her own eardrum, also being intercepted by the town's giant satellite dish while being heard by essentially everyone who lived there.

Martin and Dr. Levi were in central control at the very center, where the latter was giving the former a tour. Martin had proven to be a quick learner; he had memorized all of the station's functions in little time.

Central control was a large room just underneath the satellite, where a giant glass window overlooked the rest of the ear canal and the town below. A few monitors and desks were stationed below the window, where the workers interpreted sound waves before sending them off to central control in the brain.

Normally, sound waves would reach Fluttershy's brain no problem by simply following the entire ear, but that information would be left un-interpreted for the humans in the brain.

And right now, Dr. Levi and Martin heard something that made them pale. They looked at each other, understanding passing over their features. Several workers got up from their place at the monitors to begin screaming at each other, looking for any semblance.

"D-Doctor? She knows! SHE KNOWS!" Dr. Levi shouted, banging his fist down on a nearby table. Martin followed him for direction, even as the controllers ran past them in order to inform anybody they could.

"We were so careful! But we couldn't avoid detection! Her hearing is stronger! Although we are miniscule, she can probably hear us just barely. We obviously had some kind of effect on her body!"

"What do we do, Doctor?" Martin asked, grabbing the older man's shoulder.

Levi regarded him thoughtfully. Without any training, Martin already seemed capable of operating all of Sector 7. And for just getting here, he was taking this entire situation well.

"You! You're coming with me! To the brain! We are the only ones with this crucial information, and we must inform the leaders. I will call a meeting of the sector leaders immediately. We must avoid being detected! We would be considered nothing more than bugs to them! No! Worse! Germs! Parasites to be wiped out at the first hint of detection!"

Martin gulped. They were the last hope for humanity too.

"Now is when we take the initiative!" he walked up to a monitor and began typing information into it.
1553322222221222221111121.title: Taking the Initiative

15533222222212222211111212.content:
"On second thought, you need to stay here. I'll take the trip alone..." Dr. Levi said, holding his arm out to the stop Martin from moving, "We need all the help we can get here, in order to figure out any more information. Some of my lab assistants will be staying here. They can help you get settled in..."

Martin looked slightly perturbed, as if he wanted to argue, but he nodded nonetheless.

With that in mind, Dr. Levi took off, his white lab coat flapping in the wind behind him. He entered a room in the back of the building, where five futuristic looking pods lay ready, pointing toward adjacent holes in the ceiling.

"We heard the news already, doctor. The information should have already been received by Brain Central Control, but as a Sector Leader, you need to be there! We have already readied your escape pod!"

"Thank you, Jamison!" Dr. Levi said frantically, strapping himself into the pod and placing a helmet on his head. The aide pressed a few buttons on the nearby dashboard, giving the good doctor a thumbs up.

The hatch opened ahead of the pod, and a spring-loaded launch pad moved up. After a few quick inputs, the pod was fired to cruise at a speed of around sixty miles per hour (by their standards)

Dr. Levi flew out of the facility through the back of the eardrum, flying back through the rest of the middle ear, past the hammer, anvil and stirrup on a clear destination to Sector 1: the Brain
15533222222212222211111212.title: Trip to the Brain

15533222222212222222111.content:
Cotton candy clouds, chocolate rain, evil plants, and a constantly changing landscape. These are only a few of the chaotic plans the lord of Chaos, Discord, used in his rein over the land of Equestria. Effective but far from his only tricks. At least, of the ones that worked.

Truth is, Discord formed many plans in his long, long life. Countless bizarre schemes to bring a bit more 'fun' the lives of ponies. Some worked, he kept those, using them slowly over a long period of time to avoid being predictable. Others failed and were forgotten. But some just bored him, quickly abandoned in favor of something more interesting.

One such plan involved creating an intelligent race of super fleas. The idea was that a race of talking, magic using fleas could be used to drive poor unsuspecting ponies up the walls. Discord found a sizable colony and gave them pony level intelligence and some magic. He figured they'd build up their society and then revolt against the ponies they fed on.

Instead, the fleas formed a symbiotic relationship with their host pony at the time, a journalist named Bold Point, and stayed secret from the rest of Equestria, moving on to Bold Point's children after he died and continuing this cycle with each new generation. Needless to say, Discord was less then thrilled.

Unable to get the fleas to really do anything chaotic and unable to remove the gifts he'd given them, Discord simply left them behind, forgetting them almost immediately. That was almost 2,000 years ago. If he bothered to look again, he'd find things a little different.

(Inside Celestia's throne room)

A lone flea by the name of Zeck jumped onto the handle of Princess Celestia's bedroom door. Looking around quickly to make sure the coast was clear, Zeck smiled to himself. All was quiet and he pushed through the key hole and into the waiting bedroom.

A few quick jumps landed Zeck on Celestia's bed, where he found the unsuspecting Sun Princess sleeping soundly, completely unaware of what was about to happen to her. Zeck smiled wider and scurried across the bed to his target, Celectia's head.
15533222222212222222111.title: Discord's Legacy*

choices: Continue through the ear into the brain.
155332222222122222221111.content:
The fleas had evolved their own personalities after being left alone for 2,000 years. Such a thing would occur when retaining the intelligence of a pony.

There were good fleas, there were bad fleas, there were shy fleas, and there were brave fleas. And there was the rare flea who had nothing more on his mind than power. A flea like Zeck.

All his life, Zeck had watched the ponies from his colony. One of them could stomp out a thousand fleas with one step, but their society was structured, populous, and the most powerful nation in the world. How Zeck yearned to be able to control it.

Scurrying over Celestia's pillow, he stopped at the base of cheek and climbed up, resting upon Celestia's nose. She was laying on her back, a peaceful smile on her face. His magic would allow her to control Celestia's body completely, and there would be no pony who was the wiser. He could control all of Equestria. He just wanted to regard the body he was going to take.

Using all of his legs, he bounced up the cheek to the left, the princesses' ear the clear target. It twitched lightly in her sleep, the golden crown symbolizing her status nestled on top of her magnificent mane. Why she would wear that thing to bed was beyond Zeck.

Before he knew it, he was at the alabaster alicorn's ear, the ridge to the entrance of the ear canal directly above him. It spiralled inward with a fleshy color to the walls, covered in light white hairs. It served to remind him that even the being considered a goddess still had a corporeal body.

He bounced once more, clearing the ridge easily and entering the ear. His target was the brain, and with his magic, nothing would be able to stop him.
155332222222122222221111.title: Zeck the Megalomaniac*

1553322222221222222211111.content:
Continuing through the ear was absolutely no problem for Zeck; it was a direct passageway to Celestia's brain and there was very little wax to stop him. The princess must have kept herself clean, but who knew that would be her downfall?

Once he got through the ear, the power-hungry flea followed the fleshy pink cord up to the mind that ran all of Equestria, scurrying up the squishy grey (though in Celestia's case, more pink) matter.

He rose up to the frontal lobe, looking around. Out through the ear was really the only way he could leave if he ever needed to escape. All around him he could see the bony skull of Celestia protecting the brain from outside forces.

Too bad it couldn't protect from the inside.

Zeck tested out his front feelers, almost going mad when he realized how much magical power was contained within him. Discord had truly evolved his species thousands of years ago.

He dug the feelers into the grey matter, feeling the psychic link with the pony's mind begin to resonate with him. He couldn't believe it had been this easy. The only question left was: what next?
1553322222221222222211111.title: The Most Powerful Brain*

15533222222212222222122.title: Crystal Princess

1553322222221222222212211.content: "Boy, it's cold out" said a young human adventurer named Cody. Cody is a 13 year old traveller with a sword with lots of spells and tricks he's learned his whole life. He wears a green shirt with black pants and matching shoes and a grey jacket with a hood over his head. He was currently traveling in the chilly part of equestria and heading towards what appeared to be a city made up of crystals. Which was perfect because he's on a personal mission: Go on a fantastic voyage in this "princess" of this crystal city. Mostly for research. Cody than summoned his magic sword and appeared in his hand which was a beautiful golden blade with diamond encrusted handles. Cody chanted a spell as the sword glowed and granted him wings to fly for a closer look. He than took off and the view of the city was breathtaking. He saw residents who looked like ponies. They didn't notice him because he was up so high. He than notice a very tall Eiffel tower like structure at the center of the town. "I bet that's where the princess lives... and that the princess is pretty. Cody than casted another spell that caused him to shrink to bite size to sneak in. He also casted a speed spell to help him fly fast. For a young boy, he sure is skilled with a sword and magic. After a few seconds of fast flying he got to the tall building through one of the Windows and searched for her highness. In no time flat he found the princess who was pink with both wings and horn going to the dining room for a meal. "Ohh good timing for me!" He said as he flew after her. After landing on the dining table he saw the princess with another pony, only this one had just a horn. They both shared a kiss and nuzzle. Cody noticed this and whispered " Hmm they must be a couple having a nice meal together. Sure hope they don't mind an extra". A voice was than heard " Prince shining, princess Cadence, dinner is served. His timing could not be more better. He looked out and saw bowls of salad and plates of spaghetti which sure looked pretty good even to Cody. "Maybe a few bites couldn't hurt" he said as he snuck into the spaghetti. It was rather nice and warm, which was good considering he was out in the cold. He then started slurping some pasta which was only enough since he was small. Cody already had enough to eat and now was feeling ready to continue. Suddenly he got tangled up in the pasta and was now floating up towards the crystal princesses mouth. "Ok looks like I'm going in now" Cody said rather eagerly.
1553322222221222222212211.title: Flashfans

choices: Cadence feels a little tickle in her throat...
15533222222212222222122111.content: Cody watches right in front of Princess Cadence as she slowly brings her food (Cody included) into her mouth. When he was close enough, he had to untangle himself from the pasta and leap onto her tongue to avoid her shiny teeth. He does so by cutting the pasta with his sword and then hopping on the food just as it entered her mouth. He jumped off the food and onto her tongue as the rest of the food got chewed. But he quickly lost balance as she started chewing away making it hard to even stand up, let alone focus on magic just to make him float. Cody knew he had to get physical and that's when he saw Cadence's uvula swaying back and forth as she still chewed. "It's a long shot, but I have to try" he said. He then noticed the princess stopped chewing which means now he has a chance. Cadence tilted her head causing her food and Cody to fall down to her stomach but Cody has other plans. He rode the chewed up bits towards the throat where the dangling flesh is and with one big leap, he caught it as he watched the food slide down to Cadence's stomach. "Phew, that was close...and sorta fun" Cody said relieved. Cody made sure his grasp was hard and firm, 'I just hope she doesn't throw up though". Just then, he saw light flashing in Cadence's mouth meaning she's eating again. This time she was eating her salad and Cody watched as she chewed her salad causing the uvula to sway again, but Cody was determined to keep hanging on. After a few seconds of chewing, Cadence swallowed her chewed up salad and send it down her throat as Cody continued to watch from her uvula. "Boy, she sure can eat" Cody said humorously. "Now what to do?" He said as playfully swung on Cadence"s uvula.
15533222222212222222122111.title: Long day's journey into Cadence.

choices: Cody than sees something suspicious floating around...
155332222222122222221221111.content: "So Cadence, what did the doctor say today?" Cody heard a voice outside, apparently from the stallion. Cadence let out a sigh and said "Just that it's a little fever, which doesn't make sense because I've been feeling a little under the weather for over a week now and I'm afraid it's more than just fever". Cody heard everything while still hanging over the throat: "The princess is sick? I should probably put on a protection spell" and used his magic sword to do so, "there" he said to himself while hearing the conversation some more. "He keeps saying to take some medicine with plenty of fluids and get some rest, which I can't because of all this work I have to do." "Well why not just give one more day and see how you feel in the morning?" Shining suggested. "I suppose so" Cadence sighed, "Thanks honey" and gave him a peck on the cheek. After hearing the rest, Cody thinks for a few minutes and figures that maybe she's right, there is more to this "fever" of hers. Cody than thought to himself: "Maybe I should travel in Cadence's body some more and look into this fever she has. If it's something much worse, I could try fighting this virus and heal her. Besides, it the least I could for invasion and could help with my own research! It's a win-win! Question is though, where to start?" Looks like Cody has himself a fantastic voyage.
155332222222122222221221111.title: A conversation is heard outside...

1553322222221222222212211111.content: "What the..?" Cody than sees something suspicious and kinda scary looking. It was black, had tentacles, and was making an ominous sound like weird humming. "That doesn't look good; might need a closer look" Cody said as he finally summoned his wings, let go of the uvula and slowly fly closer to this unknown creature. Cody was getting shivers every second he got closer. After further examination he remembers cadences "fever" and realized something: "Wait, could this be some kind of virus that's making Cadence sick? Hey! Who or what are you? Cody called out. Immediately the virus said "No one. Be gone!" In a menacing tone and flew away in the upper passage of the throat. Cody was caught off guard by this, "Whoa! That thing talks?! Hey wait!" He exclaimed as he flew after it. In no time he was catching up with this monster but little did he know this virus has some tricks of it's own. Annoyed by this chase the virus uses it's tentacles to sap black magic at Cody. "Leave me alone!" It shouted as it casts lightning at Cody. Although surprised Cody managed to summon his sword and block the attack. Growing more furious it continues to zap but Cody blocks and dodges. Eventually the path they take leads them to cadences brain, the command center of her body. Worried that the virus could do something evil, Cody must defeat this monster or else...
1553322222221222222212211111.title: Internal affairs

15533222222212222222122111111.content: Cody is still on the viruses tail and the virus is getting desperate to rid himself of the young mage. Getting closer the crystal princesses brain, the virus decides to stop and hatch a scheme. Cody gets the virus trapped, "Got you now!" readying his sword to strike. "Do you now?" The virus said sounding a little cocky as it raised a tentacle threateningly. "Come any closer and I'll zap this brain until it fries!" It said evilly. Cody had to save this princess somehow, so he put away his sword and tried to talk it out. "Alright look, just tell me: who are you and what do you want?" "Well since you ask" the virus said, "I am known by very few as the dark virus, a rare type of virus that is most deadly, especially to alicorns, like this beauty we're in." it snickered sinisterly. "Never heard of ya" Cody remarked. "That's why I said known by very few" it said rather irritated. "Ok but how did you get in here and why?" Cody questioned. Well simply put, I am created from the hearts of someone who is full of anger, hatred and seeks vengeance on someone...and is very sick. Who that someone is, I don't know or care actually. All that matters is that I fulfill my purpose." "And that is?" Cody asked. "Why to turn this beauty to the darkness! All I have to do is spread darkness in every inch of this vessel! Although it will be rather difficult with pestering me. That's why I'll make a deal with you: you leave right, and I'll go easy on this beauty. If not I'll have no choice but to go berserk which will destroy you and poison this princess." "Or YOU could leave or I'll destroy YOU! Cody remarked as he drew his sword again. "Hah! Good luck! Being a rare disease, I'm also quite powerful too. The only way to hurt me is with magic as powerful as an alicorn. You? Your just a little unknown being with a stick!" The virus taunted. However, Cody still wasn't backing down look actually quite confident. "You underestimate my own power!" He said as he concentrated his own powers in his sword and then shined bright. Cody then pointed his sword towards the virus and fired a beam of light directly at it causing to shout in pain. "Aaggh! You actually hurt me?! Some non pony?! But how?!" It said. "Years of practice" Cody bravely said. "Now to finish you!" He said as he charged at the enemy. In a last ditch effort to keep it's plan going, the virus decided to split itself into 5 and all but one scattered to parts unknown. Cody was once again caught off guard, "What?!" The virus laughed, "hahaha! Thought it would be so easy eh boy? Then again I am a virus, therefore I spread like one too. You want to defeat me and save this princess? Prove it by finding the rest of me into the important organs!" Cody was frustrated but had to do something, "Fine, at least I'll take you out first!" He shouted as he thrusted his shining sword through the virus causing it to fade away. Before it completely, disappeared it had a few last words: "Not bad boy, but as long as the princess is infected, she will be in grave danger! Still want to risk your life for her? Go ahead! But I warn you now: it won't be easy. The other mes put up a fight like I did!" It finished as it faded away. Cody still put on a brave face: "Yeah well if they're anything like you were, I think I'll manage. Don't worry your highness, I'll cure you." He swore as he continued his fantastic voyage in princess Cadence. To be continued...
15533222222212222222122111111.title: Monster inside Cadence.

155332222222122222221221111111.content: Before moving on, Cody had to think long and hard about what that virus said before it faded. "Important organs..." he said as he conjured up a map of Cadences body. The important ones he knew very well we're the brain, the lungs, the stomach and the heart. Since the one in the brain was destroyed, that leaves the rest. His thoughts were interrupted when something started happening: the innards were becoming darker and more black. Outside, Cadence started looking pale and rubbed her forehead, "ughhh" she groaned. Shining armor noticed this and was starting to worry: "Cadence? Your not looking to good. Why don't you go lie down and rest? I'll clean up here." "Ohh, alright hopefully the rest of the medicine will help." She said as she went to her room while wobbling a bit. Back inside Cody gasped in realization, "Oh no! The evil viruses are already taking over, and I don't think medicine is gonna help alone. I need to hurry!" He said as he soared to the next destination. "Don't worry your highness, Dr. Cody is in the house...and in your body! To be continued...
155332222222122222221221111111.title: Where they lurk...

1553322222221222222212211111111.content: Continuing his voyage inside the crystal princess, Cody tried flying to the closest organ possible: the lungs. Just a drop down the trachea was all it takes and he was already there. Inside the lungs was very windy due to cadences breathing. Cody had to land and fold up his wings so as not to be blown uncontrollably. "Alright you piece of trash, show yourself!" He shouted without fear. He then noticed the virus flying around chuckling evilly, "hehehe. Well if it isn't the boy who beat our boss. Didn't expect you here so soon." "Yeah well guess what: you put a princess in danger by poisoning her, you better expect company, period." Cody shot back at the virus. "Ohhh well in that case, come and get me; that is if you don't mind a little wind!" It said trying to get away. Cody opened his wings back up and followed in pursuit, but was immediately being blown all around smacking into the walls of the lungs, "oof"! All the virus did was laugh at his failing, "hahaha! Aww what's the matter, having trouble getting around fly boy?" Cody scoffed in annoyance. He now knows this isn't going to be easy...unless he tried timing! He watched as the lungs got bigger and smaller due to Cadences inhaling and exhaling. Cody figured he could use this to his advantage. He than heard the virus taunting him, "aww! Giving up already? I guess whether or not I move, you won't land a blow on me, hehehe." But Cody didn't listen, instead he was waiting for the right moment. As Cadence was about to inhale, he jumped up with wings open and using the air coming in he managed to speed up right at the virus with sword I hand and slash him. *Swish*! "Arrgh!" The virus shouted. "But how did you..?!" But before it could finish, Cadence exhaled and made u turn causing him to speed right back and slash it again finishing it off as it faded into oblivion. Cody was victorious. "Well, looks like I'm Cadences breath of fresh air" he jock as he conjured up a drum and cymbals making a rimshot, ba dum psh! "Alright, on to the next one!" Cody said as he exited the lungs and flew deeper to the next destination. To be continued...
1553322222221222222212211111111.title: Breath of fresh air.

15533222222212222222122111111111.content:
As he exited the lungs, Cody dives down to his next destination inside the crystal princess: the heart. A few minutes later he comes across the bloodstream. Cody can use this to lead him to the heart. Cody then realized something: he has to swim in there and there's no air in here. Fortunately he has another trick up his sleeve...or mainly in his sword. He summons it and conjures up an air bubble around his head in order to breathe. His protection spell he casted earlier also protects him from getting soaked in the crimson substance. He was now ready to swim in the bloodstream. Cody kept swimming until he heard a sound like a drum. He knows what that is. Finally he reached the heart, a very important part of Cadence. Her heartbeats were rather soothing, like it could put anyone to sleep. Cody had to stay awake though to search for the next virus. He saw something unusual up ahead. It's gotta be it. Cody swims up to this monster sword in hand to strike it. Just then the virus spoke in an evil tone: "Heheh, look who it is, the little pest getting in our way. And here thought you were just invading a princesses privacy." Cody answered "That was my plan at first but after seeing you here I decided to make a little change; starting by kicking you germs out!" as he readied his sword. The virus just laughed: "HA! You sure you want to do that, especially considering where we are? Need I remind you where we are? One little mishap could cost this beauties life. Hehehe! I'll tell you what though: if you leave right now I won't do too much to this princess. Oh I'll still do something devious nevertheless". But Cody wasn't gonna give up that easily. Sure it was right about one thing: if he wasn't careful, well he didn't WANT to think about it. Still he had to beat this monster so he had to think hard about this. Then he got an idea: "Ok pal, you got me I'll leave. Just try to go easy on this pony at least. She IS a princess after all. Well see ya!" He said as he casted a spell the apparently made him disappear. Could it have been that easy for this virus? Did it actually win? The virus then laughs out loud: "Hahaha! that fool! Like I would just cause some minor damage here when I could do much worse! Whelp! Better get started"it said as it prepares some deadly poison to infect Cadence even more. Just then it felt a sharp pain through it's whole form: "Ugghhh! What the.." He said as a sword appeared through it. "What is this?!" He demanded. Just then the rest of the sword appeared along with something else; it was Cody! He was still here the whole time! "Gotcha! Invisibility spell!" He taunted. "Nooo! You little..." the virus tried to finish but faded into oblivion. Another virus defeated. Cody dismissed his sword and sighed in relief. "That was close! Now onto the last important part. You'll be okay, your highness." He said trying to leave the heart. Cody listened to the heart a little more first and was relaxed by it: "Mmm something I need after this stressful day is over."

To be continued...
15533222222212222222122111111111.title: Heart of the matter.

155332222222122222221221111111111.content:
Cody's voyage inside the crystal princess was nearly over. Only one destination left: the stomach. Leaving the heart, Cody kept diving down deeper and deeper until he reached the stomach...and the last of the evil virus. It was a bit tight on the way down but he had to manage until finally, he plopped down to the center of Cadence. The first thing he saw was of course the remains of salad and spaghetti from earlier. He also noticed some stomach acid, but thanks to his protection spell from earlier, it won't hurt him at all. "Boy, the princess sure can eat." He said humorously. Cody then opened his wings and started to search high and low for the monster roaming around here. Cody then noticed some food moving a bit thengot suspicious and took a closer look. Getting close enough, Cody lifted up the pieces of food...only to be surprised by the virus! "Boo!" "Agh"! They both shouted. The virus was floating right above him laughing evilly: Hahaha! Made it this far I see. So my other boys couldn't stop you! Fine then "hero". You want to defeat me and save this lovely mare? You can try, but I won't be so easy!" "Yeah, that's what your other boys said but guess what? They're gone! And so are you!"Cody exclaimed. He summoned his magic sword once again and said: "Now c'mere so I can cut you up to nothing!" The virus simply smirked: "Hmph ok small fry but first let me shake...shake things up!" Confused by that remark, Cody simply said "huh?". The virus chuckled "hehehe! Well let's just say, I hope you enjoy your ride out!" It said as it began slamming into the stomach walls. Cody was shocked to the core, seeing this, "Whoa! What are you doing!?" The virus laughed again, "Oh, just making her highness REALLY sick!" as it continued slamming. Suddenly, the stomach began to gurgle and shake violently. Outside, Cadence started feeling a pain in her stomach, like she ate too much and some is trying to get out. "Uuuugggghh" she moaned. Her face was turning green and she placed a hoof to her mouth. She was gonna throw up! Back inside, Cody noticed that both him and some of the food was rising out of Cadences stomach! The virus smiled evilly, waving "Bye bye" right before he was launched. Back outside, Cadence rushed over to the bathroom ready to barf, "Ohh, I hope this at least helps me feel a little better!" she said sickly. Back inside both Cody and the food were coming up fast. "Oh man! What now? I REALLY don't wanna go out like this! And CERTAINLY not the other way around neither! He thought. He was coming up back to the throat as he had his eyes on Cadences uvula. It was his last chance. Timing himself, he waited until he was close enough and leaped and successfully grabbed the dangling flesh as the rest of the food was spewed out of Cadence. Of course Cody looked away because he would be sick too just by watching, so he looked away disgusted. "Ugh, that's not right. Stupid virus." After a minute of barfing, Cadence finally stopped, much to hers and Cody's relief. Despite letting it all out, Cadence still felt a little irritation mostly in her throat. *Cough cough* So she then got some water and proceeded to gulp it down, unaware of someone else she's about to gulp down. Back inside, Cody was still hanging on to the uvula (even after that violent cough) and pondered: "Well now that THAT'S over with, I gotta get back down and finish the job...and fast!" Just then, he saw Cadences mouth open again seeing a tidal wave of water...which could actually help! "Works for me!" He chimed. He readied himself as the water was washing him, plucking him off the uvula in the process and rode the wave back down. He now has another chance to stop the evil virus from making the crystal princess even more sick than she already is. Back into the belly he goes!

To be continued...
